node.statement: (Normalization constraint) Since R_eps = d(T_psi* mu_eps)/d(mu_eps), we have E_{mu_eps}[R_eps] = 1, i.e., E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps + K_eps)] = 1. This fixes K_eps = -log E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)]. The divergence of K_eps exactly compensates the divergence of L_eps under mu_eps, so that R_eps = exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps - log E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)]) is a well-defined probability density for each eps.
